alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:50AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN BEDFORD...SOUTHERN HUNTINGDON...FRANKLIN...FULTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL BLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 445 AM EDT... At 349 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Hollidaysburg to 11 miles northeast of Bedford to Breezewood to Hancock. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts from the west of 50 to 55 mph and pea to dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Chambersburg, Waynesboro, Shippensburg, Greencastle, Breezewood, Guilford, St. Thomas, Fayetteville, Warfordsburg, Wayne Heights, New Enterprise, Mont Alto, Claysburg, Mercersburg, Scotland, McConnellsburg, Harrisonville, Rouzerville, Marion and Fort Loudon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
